content: Do folks feel that adding wasm64 support to the standard library (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/90382) needs a team FCP? Happy to start one if so, or to r+ if not.
well the target is already defined, which is the part I would think needs an FCP.
but as long as there's nothing too weird about it, go ahead
is it stubbed out a lot like wasm32?

cuviper said:

well the target is already defined, which is the part I would think needs an FCP.

I agree, but I wanted to make sure others felt that way.

I think having std support for -unknown-unknown targets is dubious (and has caused a number of issues already), but largely the ship has sailed on this, and it probably doesnt introduce any problems that wasm32 doesnt have.
@Thom Chiovoloni FWIW, I personally am in total agreement on that front.
I wish that neither target supported std with stubs. But since wasm32 does, wasm64 should too.
Meanwhile, I'm much more excited about wasm64-wasi. :)
